alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 31 at 3:22PM AKST until February 01 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow mixing with sleet, with the potential for freezing rain. Total snow and sleet accumulations of up to 6 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. East to Northeast winds 15 to 30 with gusts as high as 40 mph especially along the coast. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 9 PM Monday to 9 PM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains uncertainty as to the depth of warm air that moves into the area. As a result, this will impact the expected snowfall amounts. More mixing will result in less snowfall amounts and less mixing will result in higher snowfall amounts. Also, the deeper the warm air, then more freezing rain may be possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
